name: Hotel Carlton, a Joie de Vivre hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at Hotel Carlton. We found the rooms to be very clean and larger than many we have stayed at in other hotels in San Francisco. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a wine reception from 5:30 - 6:00 pm daily and on the Saturday we were there they even had someone playing music. The area is not the best since you are not in the heart of a touristy area. However, if you walk east on Sutter Street you arrive at Union Square in 10 minutes. Two blocks to the west is Van Ness Street where you can find a Peet's Coffee or a Starbucks. The room we had on the 8th floor was quiet and it's nice that you can open the windows which have screens on them. Large closet with safe. The walls, however, are thin and you can hear what's going on in the room next to you. The bathroom was a nice size and the shower pressure was very good. You do not get little bottles of shampoo, instead they have dispensers in the shower for soap, shampoo and conditioner. They do give you a bar of soap for the sink area. There is free WiFi. The price for San Francisco is very good. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice value for San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Carlton is a very funky, cute hotel. The decor was great and had a homely/well travelled feel. The staff were helpful in suggestions for the best way to see San Francisco as we were only there for a few days. The rooms were small but well appointed, plus we were not there to just sit in the room. There are also lots of great restaurants and bars nearby. !
reviews.title: Overall would highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in September, we had a fantastic time. The staff were all super helpful and nice, they always gave us directions on where we needed to go. We thought the hotel was in a great location and easy to get places via the city buses. We would go back in a flash. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant but it smelled great, the nightly wine was a plus.
reviews.title: Really Nice Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed there for 4 days (Jan 1-4). It is a quaint and old hotel (built in 1927). The host(Joel?) was very helpful and gave us a map immediately on arrival and pointed out where not to go, tenderloin area. We asked for quite room, not facing street. Joel changed the room for us. The room was clean and the closet was big. The wall was indeed very thin. On the 3rd day, our nearby room began to have people and we were able to hear them very clearly. The hotel might be close to a fire station and we heard sirens serveral times during the evening. Take earplug with you if you are light sleeper.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We parked at the sutter garage (8USD from 5PM to 8AM, secuirty patrol). I walked 10 blocks (almost all are downhills) every morning to pick up the car. It only took me 10-15mins. Sutter garage is close to Union square and Chinatown. There were few homeless people near by. But we walked every evening and did not encounter big issue. We got this hotel from priceline bid, about 71usd/night including taxes,etc. Priceline rate it as 3 * hotel. Next time, we will bid for hotel more close to union square area.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Carlton for two nights in mid-August and fell in love with it right from the start. The initial contact with the staff was enjoyable and welcoming. We were on the top floor, in a supirior room overlooking the city (action). I found myself calling it "our appartment". The room was really clean and decorated beautifully. We live right on a main street and grew up in the city so the noise, (man those firefighters sure work hard) and locals were not a problem , but for someone from a small town the surroundings after dark and the noises that come with it may get nerving. We loved the staff's humour, the "we sold your luggage on Ebay" joke never got old. The wine tasting at night made it possible to meet some new people. This was clearly the best hotel that we stayed at during our entire tour of California!
reviews.title: Hotel Carlton A+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here just one night, but we both wished we'd stayed at least one more. We were on the 7th floor (room 709 is a nice one in the corner) in a deluxe room. Nice natural lighting, free wireless, very clean and cozy room, and plenty of space for the two of us. I had asked for "the best room at this price" when I booked, adding we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, and when we arrived in the room, there was a nice bottle of wine and two glasses on our bed from the management with a card congratulating us on our anniversary. Nice touch! The front desk staff were always very pleasant and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel as one of the nicest for the price in a large city. The neighborhood is ok if you don't go much further than a couple blocks off of Sutter.
reviews.title: Excellent boutique hotel
Pretty Good
reviews.text: This hotel was part of our SWAvacations package. Our room was on the 3rd floor and I would say overall the room was a good size, clean, and the decor was very modern.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the area that the hotel is in...many of the other reviewers are accurate in saying that it is about 7 blocks from Union Square (just under a mile to the Powell Street BART/Muni station). Not much of a walk, except that you'll be doing it quite a few times if you're staying for a few days!! And make SURE you take the 'up Powell Street and then left on Sutter' route...you definitely don't want to mistakenly end up in the Tenderloin (as we did, at about 11pm!!).
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel, Amazing Value!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only 'complaint' about our room was that it was REALLY loud -- I don't think there was any soundproofing at all!? Again, we were on the 3rd floor (Room 314) and maybe it's different on other floors...but we heard a LOT of slammed doors, people and plumbing in other rooms, people talking in the hallway, garbage trucks outside, traffic, you name it!!
reviews.title: Boutique & Unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: The Carlton Hotel is an excellent choice in San Francisco as it is reasonably priced and very well located. Our 6th floor room was fresh, well decorated and comfortable. The staff was generally friendly and helpful. The hotel has its own guide sheets on various topics such as restaurants, city areas, cafés etc. which are very useful! I would recommend dinner in the hotel's Arabic fusion restaurant, Saha. The food was lovely and the setting interesting. I think they could pay a little more attention to detail when serving breakfast in the same restaurant. Service wasn't as good, tables weren't cleared, deliveries passed through while people were dining and coffee stains covered some tablecloths. The food, however, was very nice. The hotel has a nightly wine reception which we felt was a welcoming touch as it gave the chance to relax for half an hour and meet other people in the pleasant lobby area. The single recommendation when staying at the Carlton is to dine next door at Brick; it is a fantastic dining experience with delicious food whilst you watch the chefs in the open kitchen.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, good location

likes.disliked: — Collect the hotel's printed guides as they're very useful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our holiday (Sept 10th-13th). We had been to Vegas and Los Angeles and I was really looking forward to visiting San Francisco. The hotel was great. Nice comfortable room which had everything you needed within. The best bit of all was the front desk guys (they were a couple of unconcious comedians). Very very nice and helpful. My only regret was that I had went to Los Angeles for 3 nights first and would have loved to have spent 5 nights or so in San Fran instead because they're was so much to see & do we didn't get it all done.
reviews.title: Great hotel and first class staff!!!!

likes.liked: — Definately the front desk cleks, hilarious!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Would we go back?? definately yes!!!
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel, everything you could want!!!!

likes.liked: — The rooms, the location, the staff
likes.disliked: — Rooms a little noisy but not to excess that it ruined sleeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I hesitate in booking this hotel again??? I would definately not hesitate and would book this hotel. It has all you need for a perfect stay and the staff definately make the hotel what it is!!!!
reviews.title: Great value, great location, lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: What a fantastic find this Boutique hotel is................
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — great vibe, great rooms, complimentary wine in the lobby in late afternoon

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Carlton for three nights in June. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was a little smalller than expected but comfortable enough for a night's sleep. Just be aware when it's recycling/garbage day, especially if you get a room at the back/side since they usually work at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Unfortunately, there were not too many eateries nearby. You can always pick up some essentials at the First Rite closeby. But lucky for us we found a great place for breakfast. It's a couple of blocks north of the hotel, an older style diner called Golden Coffee. It's run by two older Chinese gentlemen who will make you a full breakfast for a very reasonable price. If you're in a rush, don't bother going there, it's definitely not a fast food outlet.
reviews.title: Very nice! Great Value. But bring ear-plugs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Overall, our hotel stay was quite uneventful (which is good!) and the location away from the hustle & bustle of downtown was nice. We would definitely stay here again when we go back to San Francisco.
reviews.title: nice hotel
Great hotel!
reviews.text: In SF for a trade show. Got there well before check-in and fantastic staff let me into a room early (thanks!). It was an upgrade, but only cost another ~$10/night and included high-speed interenet. I missed that evening's wine tasting, but It was my birthday my last night there and the staff offered me a bottle. I accepted a glass, and then some Aussie tourists sang HBTY on the elevator ride up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Good looking, clean rooms. 'Modern' decor in a vintage hotel, but without being cold. Had a very international flavor. Decent views of city from 8th floor. Loved the ceiling fans and the ability to open windows. And this may sound odd, but great clock-radio/CD and in-room coffee. Free car to Moscone Ctr. very helpful too.
reviews.title: Gio And Theo Are The Carlton's Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2004, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is great value! I can't believe it is rates only a 2 star?
reviews.title: Good Value!

likes.liked: — Ethnic Charm, Clean and good sized rooms
likes.disliked: — 6 blocks away from Union Square-a bit of a walk

reviews.title: Great hotel and experience!
reviews.text: It has an ethnic charm and the rooms are very clean and decently sized.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you don't mind walking about six blocks to Union Square?
reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this one (for the price)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also wouldn't walk around alone at night. It can be a bit daunting!
reviews.title: Great hotel to stay

likes.disliked: — we didn't have any problems at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved the Hotel Carlton! Our deluxe queen room was huge, as was the walk-in closet. The bathroom did lack low storage space (though there was a nice double glass shelf on the wall), but looked new. The entire room was very clean, and the bed was comfortable. Even with the window shut, there was quite a but if street noise. That is to be expected in SF though.
reviews.title: Fun and Hip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel, it is not in the best location of the city but is a really peaceful area, you have plenty of restaurants and grocery stores around so you can go out anytime and get anything you need with just a short walk.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I heard no noises at night but ambulance and firefighters sirens one night.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are very comfy and well decorated, huge closet included and a new LCD TV. Huge bathroom too.
reviews.title: decent hotel in a decent part of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can really say that for the cost this was a high value for your money hotel. I can recommend it to everyone.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: Front desk is also very helpful. Parking is not a real problem here, there is a parking in front of the hotel and it costs USD 20 per day, and you can come and go any time and dont have to pay any extras.
reviews.title: Confusing but Pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there for two nights in November. Friendly and helpful staff. Ok rooms, clean and tidy. Safe neighborhood, close to union square. We missed the free wine offerings. That would have been another plus us staying at the hotel if we were at the hotel at that time of the day. Good value hotel in the heart of SF.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the stay at Hotel Carlton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we found the reception staff very friendly and helpful. We were immediately put at our ease when checking in as the receptionist gave us a map, showed us parts of the city best avoided (which was only a few choice blocks) where to catch the bus to the wharf, and also invited us down to the lobby at 5.30 for free wine and music including a very cool and accomplished keyboard performance from the same receptionist!.
reviews.title: A very welcoming and friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were excellent and always willing to help with bags, airport transfers, tips on what to see etc. The hotel is clean, with large rooms and walk in wardrobe/closet. Some reviews have commented on the 'shabby chic' aspect of the hotel. It may be a little rough around the edges to those used to five star Hilton style accommodation, but it's bohemian and friendly style with open fire, sofas and art books to browse through in the lobby certainly made us feel right at home. We hope to visit San Francisco again, and would be very satisfied if we stayed again at the Carlton.
reviews.title: A safe bet in San Fran

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Carlton for 3 nights in early May 2010 and as you would expect, being in San Francisco, the hotel was old and charming. Sound insulation is obviously its major problem. The wind just howls through the place and we heard our neighbour snoring all night as if he was in the same room as us. I didn’t really mind, we just accepted it for what it was, an older, character-filled place to stay. The décor was really comfy, exotic and inviting. It was a bit of a hike to get to the central areas of the city from the hotel, but we’re not afraid of pounding the pavement and caught the trolley a couple of times to get to where we needed to go. The rate of $126US was for the room only. For breakfast I would recommend Golden Coffee Shop, the prawn omelette and pancakes were yum. And for lunch or a snack I would strongly recommend Swan Oyster Depot on Polk St, and Chutney on Jones St for a cheap Indian feast, all within walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Mixed Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a quiet, private stay. But if you’re looking for a reasonably priced, clean and inviting hotel and you don’t mind strolling the streets, then go for this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for a decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: When I got in after 10PM (after Amtrak was even later than usual), the front desk, which I had warned via cell phone in advance, told me that since the remaining rooms in the price range I had reserved for faced the street, they would give a larger room on the 9th (top) floor instead. The staff seemed this eager to please throughout my 4-day stay, quick with directions and advice. The room itself was a decent size with a walk-in closet, in-room safe, and lots of sunlight. I only used the restaurant once for breakfast, which was pretty good if pricey. (At that, it wasn't any worse than the famous places around Union Square.)
reviews.title: A nice place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: It is a bit of a trek to Union Square, and you'll need transit to get almost anywhere else, but bus stops are right nearby and the Muni will eventually get you where you want. There's also a good Internet cafe, Quetzal, about two blocks away. One caveat: you really don't want to venture south past Geary St., two streets down, even in the daytime. You'll run into panhandlers anyway, but that happens in lots of places in San Francisco.
reviews.title: A little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We stayed in the Carlton for 7 nights, the staff were friendly, helpful and always had time for you and made you smile with their little jokes. The rooms were very comfortable and clean with everything you needed for an enjoyable stay. The wine hour in the evening was an ideal way to wind down after a long day sightseeing before getting ready for an evening out. The location is good, not too far from Union Square and easy to get around, we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Find in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: My wife, her sister and I stayed at this hotel from June 09 through June 13th. The hotel and rooms are very clean and comfortable. Despite what one reviewer said about the neighborhood, we did not feel threatened once, in fact, everybody seemed to mind their own business and a few even said a friendly hello. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and the hotel is a quick walk / bus ride from Powell Street Station if you take the BART from the Airport. All sites were a short bus or cable car ride away and with the MUNI pass, you can hop on and off as you wish. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: FANTASTIC
Hotel Carlton
reviews.text: This was by far the best Hotel I had stayed at for a while. The service was excellend and the staff friendly and welcoming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When my Wife and I pulled up to the front of the hotel having driven through a pretty dodgy looking neighborhood not too far away, we were more than a little unnerved by what we were getting into. This hotel is a corporate preffered hotel for my company and we decided to stay here. We had a one night reservation. Once inside, our trepidation melted away. It was cosy and the staff were wonderful. As stated in other reviews, they were friendly, attentive and made solid suggestions for places to eat (including their own restaurant for breakfast Sun AM). The room was fairly spacious and comfortable with a good sized bed and quality linens. My Wife remarked that she felt like she was in Europe and it did have a very European feel to it to us. There is a very nice area in the lobby with couches and a fireplace. A good place to sit down, enjoy a glass of wine and meet your fellow travellers.
reviews.title: Personal Service Makes the Difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had mentioned matter of factly that it was my birthday this night and I was told that they offer a free bottle of wine for such an occasion. The staff asked as we headed out to dinner whether they could bring the wine to our room. I said 'that would be nice'. As we returned from dinner to our room, it had the bed turned down and a dozen heliu balloons hanging from the ceiling with party hats, noise makers and glasses for the wine along with a personalized birthday card. I was most impressed. They went over and above the call in providing this service. It was a really nice touch.
reviews.title: Nice little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I feel compelled to recommend this hotel with such tremendous customer service. This attention to detail should be rewarded and I would stay here again. Kudos to the staff for making this a memorable stay and birthday.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Cartlon hotel is fab
reviews.text: The hotel is situated close to the local transit to get to Fisherman's Wharf or other areas conveniently. We walked around to find a dinner spot and we enjoyed Sushi Rocks (a recommendation from the staff again).

reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing
reviews.text: This is a nice friendly hotel. The rooms are not large but then may city hotels have smallish rooms. The rooms are nicely decorated and extremely clean. The reception staff were brilliant. They were so friendly and answered any questions with patience. On arrival we were given wine to drink and one night when the restaraunt was shut and we were unable to purchase drinks, the reception staff gave us two bottles of wine for free. The lobby area is lovely. We sat most nights after we had been out for meal and drank wine and mingled with other guests. We even played scrabble one night! The only tip I have is make sure you take ear plugs although I didn't hear any other guests in their rooms the noise from outside is fairly loud especially when a fire engine goes by. With plugs no probs! The reception staff will point you in right direction for evening meals and busses to local attractions etc. If you want a large deluxe hotel don't go here but if you want a small friendly well maintained, clean hotel within easy reach of most attractions then this is the one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nicely-appointed hotel, super-comfy bed, thoroughly clean bathroom, extremely friendly staff. I think complaints about the room size are unwarranted - those people are probably not used to urban hotels, and for an urban hotel at that price, it's actually big! There's a large enough closet for storing your luggage and whatever else you acquire during your stay.
reviews.title: Good place to stay
scary place to be
reviews.text: The area is not as seedy as some reviewers think it is. I see more panhandlers/homeless people walking from my office to the subway station on the corner than I did walking around the area. Colorful characters do come out at night, but color is a good thing, remember that. San Francisco is not only about the bridge and shopping in chain stores around Union Square.

reviews.title: Very 'San Franciscan'
reviews.text: Almost every review points out the noise - definitely wear earplugs when you sleep. You may also want to avoid a room by the elevator, the constant dinging got on my nerves in the mornings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a valet parking package, but you end up paying about $23 day in taxes! Taxes on taxes - oh to drive a car in California! I have no idea if that saved us any money when it came to overnight parking rates in general.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: did not like this hotel when arrived given a map and told dont go to tenderloin area as there are drug dealers homeless e.c.t there
reviews.title: Gr8 price clean rooms a little noisy at times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Nice Hotel, Very helpful and friendly staff, decent room on 7th floor. The wine reception was a nice touch, but keyboardist so loud as to be painful. A few Police/ambulance sirens at night but not unreasonable for urban hotel. HUGE walk-in closets we could have sublet....Free wireless internet a big plus. Excellent transportation to airport..Not as convenient to public transportation as I would have liked but only because Powell St. cable car was broken down during our visit. would stay there again
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We've just returned after three weeks at Hotel Carlton (that's right, three whole weeks!). It was great!! We had a 9th floor room, which may explain why we didn't find the city noise as bad as some have, but then if you don't want sirens. trucks etc, don't stay in the middle of a city! We didn't experience much of the 'thin walls' issue that others have written about. There were a few noisy people in the wee small hours occasionally, but you get that at any hotel.
reviews.title: What A Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was beautiful. The lobby is spacious and pleasant, with lots of room to lounge about in comfort and warmth (which is great when enjoying the complimentary wine at 5.30 each day). The decor is wonderful. Our room was spacious. While a fridge would have been nice (we could have asked for one I think, but didn't bother) everything else we needed was there, and having a large walk-in wardrobe meant we could store our cases etc right out of the way.
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel but bordering on area with dodgy people about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only very minor issue we had was that the radiator which delivered the central heating was rather noisy when working. Fortunately that was onlty a couple of times a day (although I have to say we were always warm) and if it had been a real problem we would have mentioned it to reception.
reviews.title: What a little gem
2nd floor room was terribly noisy
reviews.text: The area borders the upper Tenderloin so, yes, it is gritty, but not overly so (we noted many of the apartments nearby were actually described as 'lower Nob Hill', so it depends on how optomistic you are really). San Francisco is full of homeless people and panhandlers, and we actually found more of these in Union Sqare than around the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Just finished a three night stay at the Carlton and it was the best prpperty I have stayed at in the last 10 years of San Francisco visits. The staff, friendly and always ready to help, knew their job and had recommendation for any question.
reviews.title: Superb Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: The deluxe room on the 7th floor was large, bright and provided a fine view of the lower Nob Hill area and Financial district. I would agree with other reviewers that the bathroom was a bit plain and does need a shelf to complement the pedistal sink.
reviews.title: A lovely boutique hotel
Nice hotel in the heart of San Francisco
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this location to anyone who appreciates a limited service boutique hotel and the carlton will be my prperty of choise for future visits.

reviews.title: The Carlton - Good value for money place to stay in SF!
reviews.text: Having previously stayed at the terrible Holiday Inn near Fisherman's Wharf, this hotel was a total contrast - excellent location, 5-10 minutes walk from Union Square, and a beautifully decorated room. The hotel has a modern oriental theme, and the reception is great with a real fire, squashy sofas and loads of character. The reception staff were brisk and efficient and the porter was very attentive. There is also free wireless internet in the lobby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Our room was very clean, and I suspect the bathroom was installed recently as it was so pristine. The room had a ceiling fan, loads of unusual light fittings, a seperate walk-in cupboard with ironing board, safe and hairdryer and really good quality bedding. It was so nice to have a proper duvet rather than synthetic scratchy sheets that many hotels use.
reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
Lovely Carlton
reviews.text: I stayed at the Carlton for 11 nights and it was great!

reviews.title: A Gem
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, our room was clean and i loved the toiletries.

reviews.title: Something special at the Carlton
reviews.text: The frontdesk staff were very friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Modern, clean, friendly and a great deal
reviews.text: And shopping paradise at Union Square is just a few blocks away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Loved it, and can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Comfortable but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Carlton for four nights in October 2007. After having read the reviews on this website I e-mailed the hotel in advance and asked them to allocate us a quiet room. Unfortunately I cannot remember the number of the room we were eventually allocated, but whilst we did not hear noise from other bedrooms, the noise from the street below during the nights was very loud. I do remember that we stayed on the eighth floor and our room overlooked the street to the side of the hotel rather than Sutter Street. I would recommend bringing ear plugs if you are going to stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel but bring your earplugs

likes.disliked: — The noise from the street below

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: Despite this, we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Carlton. The room was spacious enough for us. There was a large wardrobe with ironing board and iron. There was a hairdryer provided and a radio alarm clock with CD player. The room was extermely clean and well serviced each day.
reviews.title: Some high and some low points - overall, would not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a 15 minute walk to Union Square, but is on a main bus route to a number of places. We purchased a travel card and got around a lot of places, including Haight Ashbury, Pacific Heights, Golden Gate Bridge by bus.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were very helpful when we asked them queries. The wine reception is a lovely touch which we appreciated after a hard day walking the streets of San Francisco.
reviews.title: Everest Floor not worth the money...
Loved it!
reviews.text: I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to people, as long as they take earplugs along with them for the street noise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 wks in April while my father was ill at a hospital nearby. I was very fortunate to stumble upon this lovely littel hotel as it became my home away from home....
reviews.title: My home away from home.....

likes.disliked: — Walls can be a little thin...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From Edgar the doorman to Theo one of the managers, everyone was fantastic.The staff are all warm and friendly and seem to know all guests by name. The 1730pm wine service in the lobby is an added nice touch as well so you can get to know your fellow guests.
reviews.title: Very nice stay
basic
reviews.text: the Arab fusion restaurant is also excellent, Saha I think it is called. Very good cuisine and genorous portions. Very good wine list as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The prices here are very competitive. It is only a 5-10min walk to union Sq but you are also close to Polk Gulch which has cute little bars/boutiques and cafes.
reviews.title: Perefect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Safety wise I never had an issue. It is just at the edge of the Tenderloin but totally safe but like anywhere, be careful at night.
reviews.title: Great option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed two nights at the Hotel Carlton in early September (we spent 4 nights in San Francisco and wanted to try out two different hotels - the Carlton was our second hotel). We very much enjoyed our stay. The lobby of the hotel is just lovely. The furnishings are from all over the world. It feels very welcoming and after being out and about all day, it felt like a great place to "come home" to. There is a wine reception in the evening. The rooms feel equally welcoming. Our room felt more like we were staying at a friends home in their guest room instead of a hotel. There were photos from Tibet on the walls. The closets are large. The bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful San Francisco Hotel

likes.liked: — the lobby and the way room felt like visiting someone's home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: The only complaint would be that the bathroom was quite small (but the lovely lobby is worth putting up with a small bathroom). The staff is very friendly. The location is excellent. The hotel is close to most places one wants to go to in San Francisco (walking distance or within easy access to public transportation). We loved our stay at the Carlton. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Nice Stay...Just a little noisey early in the mornings

likes.disliked: — paying for internet service and the noise

reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Carlton
reviews.text: We stayed for one night at the Carlton. The lobby was decorated beautifully. The rooms were small but like the lobby decorated nicely. The bathrooms were modern and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: This hotel has the best sleeping beds; I just wish I could of slept longer. At about 6am you could hear everything outside, including the neighbors taking their showers.
reviews.title: Would be great....except....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is awesome. Very good customer service. All in all I wold stay here again.
reviews.title: We were very impressed with the Carlton

likes.liked: — The staff and free wine tasting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights at the Carlton. We were a little concerned before arriving after reading about the location, but were happy to realize these concerns were mainly unfounded.
reviews.title: Friendly and Ecclectic...
Great stay!
reviews.text: The hotel itself was delightful, the walls a little thin, but what can one expect from a very old building. The staff were wonderful, curtious, friendly and ever helpful. The neighbourhood was eclecctic and fasinating. We felt safe wherever we walked. Would definately stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: My mom and I stayed at the Carlton for three nights. We arrived at 11:30 AM and were immediately given an available room. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Good Place
Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: The staff was always very helpful with directions and even offered to help us purchase theater tickets when were having trouble getting a hold of ticketmaster!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: They promptly responded our complaint about hearing some loud noises late at night, then followed up with us the next day!
reviews.title: Hated the Carlton

description: The historic Hotel Carlton offers an international ambiance paired with outstanding guest service. Built in 1927, this nine-story San Francisco hotel is 3 blocks from the California Street cable car line, 6 blocks from Union Square, 8 blocks from the main entrance to Chinatown and 9 blocks from Civic Center. Complimentary evening wine receptions are held in Hotel Carlton's lobby nightly. In addition, Hotel Carlton provides complimentary wireless internet to all guests; upgraded bandwidth is also available (surcharge applies). All 161 non-smoking guestrooms at Hotel Carlton feature Tibetan mountain-themed art, hand-painted Moroccan tables, ceiling fans, and marble-top desks. The public spaces showcase cross-cultural design that incorporates treasures from Africa, India, Nepa, Laos and Asia. Our restaurant Saha features award-winning Arabic Fusion cuisine.
